intro: Dondia insularis, commonly known as the island dondia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal and sandy habitats, often growing in shallow water or on rocky shores. Dondia insularis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
